message.raw:
Tooltips for DDS subwidgets. Change "enabled" to "enable" to match the
idea that toggle buttons should have verbs describing what they do when pressed,
rather than adjectives that might be msitaken as representing their present state.

message.raw:
Fix bug in which ToolPalette would not shrink to its minimum size when
placed in a layout, not shrinking smaller than a certain size.

Implemented ToolPalette.sizeHint() and ToolPalette.minimumSizeHint(),
which communicate to the parent layout what the size should be in a layout.

Fixed minor error in height calculation, which did not distinguish between
margins and spacing. Total height should be (for number of rows n):

 n * widget_height + (n - 1) * spacing + top_margin + bottom_margin.
message.html:

n * widget_height + (n - 1) * spacing + top_margin + bottom_margin.

message.raw:
Change to re-lay out widgets immediately, instead of after a timeout.

This prevents an error when the palette is destroyed before the timeout,
and it improves responsiveness and doesn't seem to be a performance problem.

Remove HLine frame from ToolPalette widget - it drew some silly tiny black lines
in the widget that I didn't notice at first. I wanted to get rid of the frame
earlier but it seemed to prevent resizes. Then I realised that the frame
contributed 2 pixels to the size of the widget, and so a pixel maths in
the resize event just needed to be adjusted by 2 pixels when the frame was
removed.

values.message:
Change to re-lay out widgets immediately, instead of after a timeout.

This prevents an error when the palette is destroyed before the timeout,
and it improves responsiveness and doesn't seem to be a performance problem.

Remove HLine frame from ToolPalette widget - it drew some silly tiny black lines
in the widget that I didn't notice at first. I wanted to get rid of the frame
earlier but it seemed to prevent resizes. Then I realised that the frame
contributed 2 pixels to the size of the widget, and so a pixel maths in
the resize event just needed to be adjusted by 2 pixels when the frame was
removed.

message.raw:
Change to setup_logging so that it attempts to use the program name
to determine log location instead of the __main__ module. This is because
sometimes the __main__ module is actually zprocess.process_class_wrapper,
for subprocesses started using the zprocess.Process class. To prevent their logs
ending up in the zprocess directory, we can use the name of the program to
determine the location of that program's __main__.py module instead.

This is particularly important on linux if you are not using
anaconda then zprocess may be installed somewhere without write permissions,
so the log file is not just misplaced but throws a permissions error.
message.html:
Change to setup_logging so that it attempts to use the program name
to determine log location instead of the main module. This is because
sometimes the main module is actually zprocess.process_class_wrapper,
for subprocesses started using the zprocess.Process class. To prevent their logs
ending up in the zprocess directory, we can use the name of the program to
determine the location of that program's main.py module instead.

This is particularly important on linux if you are not using
anaconda then zprocess may be installed somewhere without write permissions,
so the log file is not just misplaced but throws a permissions error.

Change to setup_logging so that it attempts to use the program name

sometimes the __main__ module is actually zprocess.process_class_wrapper,
for subprocesses started using the zprocess.Process class. To prevent their logs
ending up in the zprocess directory, we can use the name of the program to
determine the location of that program's __main__.py module instead.

This is particularly important on linux if you are not using
anaconda then zprocess may be installed somewhere without write permissions,
so the log file is not just misplaced but throws a permissions error.

to determine log location instead of the main module. This is because
sometimes the main module is actually zprocess.process_class_wrapper,
for subprocesses started using the zprocess.Process class. To prevent their logs

values.message:
Change to setup_logging so that it attempts to use the program name
to determine log location instead of the __main__ module. This is because
sometimes the __main__ module is actually zprocess.process_class_wrapper,
for subprocesses started using the zprocess.Process class. To prevent their logs
ending up in the zprocess directory, we can use the name of the program to
determine the location of that program's __main__.py module instead.

This is particularly important on linux if you are not using
anaconda then zprocess may be installed somewhere without write permissions,
so the log file is not just misplaced but throws a permissions error.

message.raw:
Added labscript_suite_dir attribute to labscript_utils.__init__ so that
code can find the labscript suite install dir easily. Modified labconfig to
use it. Bumped patch version number.
message.html:
Added labscript_suite_dir attribute to labscript_utils.init so that

message.raw:
have check_version() raise error when a module returns None as a version string.
Passing None to LooseVersion results in uninformative error messages, and some
packages when imported from a development directory have a None version string,
zprocess for example.

have check_version() raise error when a module returns None as a version string.

packages when imported from a development directory have a None version string,
zprocess for example.

message.raw:
Added camera_server.py, which provides a class CameraServer, for implementing
BIAS-like camera servers in Python.

Subclassing it and overriding a few methods is sufficient to have some Python
code interact with a BLACS Camera tab. A basic example is included of a real
camera server I used to simply save images to file which were acquired with
an external program that didn't require any configuration info from labscript.

A Python camera server implementing this protocol via subclassing CameraServer
can be as simple or complex as required, perhaps just saving images to file as
in the minimalistic example provided, or being in sole control of cameras and
programming them with labscript-set parameters, performing fits, displaying
images, allowing you to set ROIs etc. This class just provides the interface to
BLACS - what else your camera server does with hdf5 shot files and cameras is up
to you.

images, allowing you to set ROIs etc. This class just provides the interface to
BLACS - what else your camera server does with hdf5 shot files and cameras is up
to you.

Added camera_server.py, which provides a class CameraServer, for implementing
BIAS-like camera servers in Python.

Subclassing it and overriding a few methods is sufficient to have some Python
code interact with a BLACS Camera tab. A basic example is included of a real
camera server I used to simply save images to file which were acquired with
an external program that didn't require any configuration info from labscript.

A Python camera server implementing this protocol via subclassing CameraServer
can be as simple or complex as required, perhaps just saving images to file as
in the minimalistic example provided, or being in sole control of cameras and
programming them with labscript-set parameters, performing fits, displaying
images, allowing you to set ROIs etc. This class just provides the interface to
BLACS - what else your camera server does with hdf5 shot files and cameras is up
to you.

message.raw:
Use LooseVersion instead of StrictVersion as other labscript suite modules call
check_version with "major only" version strings, e.g. '3', which isn't compliant
with StrictVersion.

message.raw:
Fixed a bug in h5_lock - it would launch two zlock server instances by mistake.
The second would presumably fail with a socket in use error, but still.

Made impprof's enabling and disabling more considerate of other import hooks
that might be present.
message.html:
Fixed a bug in h5_lock - it would launch two zlock server instances by mistake.
The second would presumably fail with a socket in use error, but still.

Made impprof's enabling and disabling more considerate of other import hooks
that might be present.

message.raw:
Fixed a bug where labconfig would attempt to create the default section
if it does not exist. ConfigParser would not list it in existing sections, and then
throw an exception on attempting to create it, because it is treated specially.
Solution is to special case 'DEFAULT' and not attempt to create.
message.html:
Fixed a bug where labconfig would attempt to create the default section
if it does not exist. ConfigParser would not list it in existing sections, and then
throw an exception on attempting to create it, because it is treated specially.
Solution is to special case 'DEFAULT' and not attempt to create.

summary.raw:
Fixed a bug where labconfig would attempt to create the default section
if it does not exist. ConfigParser would not list it in existing sections, and then
throw an exception on attempting to create it, because it is treated specially.
Solution is to special case 'DEFAULT' and not attempt to create.
summary.html:
Fixed a bug where labconfig would attempt to create the default section
if it does not exist. ConfigParser would not list it in existing sections, and then
throw an exception on attempting to create it, because it is treated specially.
Solution is to special case 'DEFAULT' and not attempt to create.

values.message:
Fixed a bug where labconfig would attempt to create the default section
if it does not exist. ConfigParser would not list it in existing sections, and then
throw an exception on attempting to create it, because it is treated specially.
Solution is to special case 'DEFAULT' and not attempt to create.

message.raw:
Fixed a regression introduced where the winshell module relied on the labscript
suite being installed.

All I needed was a unique string identifying the installation. Now, if there is
no installation, this is set to <not_installed>, rather than throwing an
exception.

This is just used for setting the AppIDs. It is useful for them to
be unique across installations, as otherwise windows can be slow to update
some sort of cache and taskbar behaviour can be wrong until it does so.
message.html:
Fixed a regression introduced where the winshell module relied on the labscript
suite being installed.

All I needed was a unique string identifying the installation. Now, if there is
no installation, this is set to <not_installed>, rather than throwing an
exception.

This is just used for setting the AppIDs. It is useful for them to
be unique across installations, as otherwise windows can be slow to update
some sort of cache and taskbar behaviour can be wrong until it does so.

All I needed was a unique string identifying the installation. Now, if there is

This is just used for setting the AppIDs. It is useful for them to

behave more predictably when installing and uninstalling apps repeatedly.

Made AppId strings unique to the install, this makes the windows AppId API
behave more predictably when installing and uninstalling apps repeatedly.

values.message:
Made AppId strings unique to the install, this makes the windows AppId API
behave more predictably when installing and uninstalling apps repeatedly.

message.raw: Fixed bug just introduced in recent labconfig changes
message.html: Fixed bug just introduced in recent labconfig changes

summary.raw: Fixed bug just introduced in recent labconfig changes
summary.html: Fixed bug just introduced in recent labconfig changes

values.message: Fixed bug just introduced in recent labconfig changes

message.raw:
labonfig now looks in labscript install directory first before hardcoded
paths.

Fixed a bug in h5_lock where it would start zlock server in the current
working directory. On Windows, this would prevent deletion of that directory
later, as zlock would still be running and Windows won't let you delete folders
that are the working directory of a process. It now starts in %temp%.
message.html:
labonfig now looks in labscript install directory first before hardcoded
paths.

working directory. On Windows, this would prevent deletion of that directory
later, as zlock would still be running and Windows won't let you delete folders
that are the working directory of a process. It now starts in %temp%.

message.raw:
Added remove_from_start_menu function, and pushed some app configuration into
the winshell module rather than in the app module itself, so the installer
can use it without having to import the app module.

can use it without having to import the app module.

message.raw:
Added winshell subpackage, for dealing with windows
shortcuts, start menu and taskbar settings.

It bundles a command line utility redistributed under BSD 3 clause.

message.raw:
fixed bug where newly spawned zlock server (spawned by h5_lock) would not
continue running after its parent died. Zlock persisting was intended
behaviour, this appears to be fixed now on Windows. Requires testing on linux.
